title: Operation post haste
creator_credit: Department of Postmaster-General, J.W. Hutchinson and John Fitzsimons
brief_description: Presents the Post Office’s new services to the public, including air mailing letters where it would speed delivery. Modern mail-handling machinery expedites the delivery of 200 million letters each year. By using the recommended standard size envelope and folding enclosures correctly, so that letters do not have to be handled manually, the public can help the Post Office to provide a speedy service.
